summary: This document is an email chain from August 12, 2019, forwarding a request from attorney Martin G. Weinberg to the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC). Weinberg, acting on behalf of Jeffrey Epstein's family, requests the preservation and production of all documents, videos, and evidence related to Epstein's detention, a prior incident on July 23, 2019, and his death on August 10, 2019. The email also includes a prior notification from the MCC's Supervisory Staff Attorney informing of Epstein's death.

keyFacts: Attorney Martin G. Weinberg, on behalf of Epstein's family, formally requested the preservation of all evidence related to Epstein's detention and death immediately after his passing.
The request highlights a prior incident on July 23, 2019, which was investigated as an attempted suicide, indicating concerns about Epstein's welfare before his death.
The request is exceptionally broad, seeking videos, staff logs, medical records, internal communications, and any physical evidence (like a note or ligature) from Epstein's cell.
The document shows the family's legal team moving swiftly to secure evidence, suggesting early suspicion or a desire for an independent investigation into the circumstances of Epstein's death.
The MCC's Supervisory Staff Attorney had officially notified recipients of Epstein's death on August 10, 2019, stating the investigation was ongoing.
